= Details =

In order to use this you currently need to modify the jmonkeyengine source. Until eventually this might be in the trunk.

Here is a patch for the com.jme3.scene.control.CameraControl.
What id does is simply replacing two fields, camera and controlDir to protected, in order to be able to access them in StereoCamControl which extends it.
# This patch file was generated by NetBeans IDE
# Following Index: paths are relative to: C:\Projects\jme3\src\core\com\jme3\scene\control
# This patch can be applied using context Tools: Patch action on respective folder.
# It uses platform neutral UTF-8 encoding and \n newlines.
# Above lines and this line are ignored by the patching process.
Index: CameraControl.java
--- CameraControl.java Base (BASE)
+++ CameraControl.java Locally Modified (Based On LOCAL)
@@ -65,8 +65,8 @@
          */
         SpatialToCamera;
     }
-    private Camera camera;
-    private ControlDirection controlDir = ControlDirection.SpatialToCamera;
\ No newline at end of file
+    protected Camera camera;
+    protected ControlDirection controlDir = ControlDirection.SpatialToCamera;
\ No newline at end of file
 
     /**
      * Constructor used for Serialization.

That's it!
Except you also need to add oculuslib.jar to your project as a library.

Run TestStereoCams.java to see and example.
